TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PanelStyle extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

Docs.summary: Represents the style for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class is used to represent the style settings for a panel control. It encapsulates the properties that control the appearance of a panel and can be applied to multiple panel controls to provide a common appearance.
You can specify an image to display in the background of the panel by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property. The horizontal alignment of the contents of the panel is indicated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property. The direction of controls that contain text within the panel control can be specified by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object and setting its properties. This example has two parts:
A partial class, `PanelStylecs_aspx`, that demonstrates creating a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object and setting its properties.
A Web Forms page that uses the `PanelStylecs_aspx` example as its code-behind file.
The first part of the example demonstrates creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object, `myPanelStyle`, and setting its properties. Then the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ApplyStyle%2A> method is called for both the `Panel1` panel and the `Panel2` panel, and `myPanelStyle` is applied to both of them.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]
The second part of the example shows an .aspx file that is used with the previous example.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstylecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstylevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the background image for the panel control.
Docs.value: The URL of the background image for the panel control. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property specifies the URL of the background image for the panel control. For this property to work, an image file must exist at the specified location. If the specified image file is not accessible, then the panel control is displayed without a background image.
## Examples The following code example applies the same background image to two panel controls, `Panel1` and `Panel2`. For this example to work correctly, you must provide your own image. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void CopyFrom (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void CopyFrom(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub CopyFrom (s As Style)
public: override void CopyFrom(System::Web::UI::WebControls::Style ^ s);
override this.CopyFrom : System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style -> unit

Docs.param: A object that represents the style settings to copy.
Docs.summary: Duplicates the style properties of the specified object for the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style settings of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object for the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method copies non-blank elements from the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object, `s`. Any element that is defined in `s` replaces any element that is defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object. To replace only those style settings left blank in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection Direction { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection Direction

member this.Direction : System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which to display controls that include text in a panel control.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property specifies the direction in which to display controls that include text in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection> values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|The content direction is not set.| |`LeftToRight`|Child controls that include text are displayed from left to right.| |`RightToLeft`|Child controls that include text are displayed from right to left.|
If you specify <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.LeftToRight>, child controls that include text display from left to right. If you specify <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.RightToLeft>, child controls that include text display right to left. Use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.RightToLeft> to display text for languages that are written from right to left, such as Arabic or Hebrew.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> properties of two panel controls, `Panel1` and `Panel2`, to the `ContentDirection.LeftToRight` enumeration value. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The direction is not one of the values.

member this.HorizontalAlign : System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the contents within a panel control.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property specifies the horizontal alignment of the contents within a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign> enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`NotSet`|The horizontal alignment is not set.| |`Left`|The contents of the panel are left-aligned.| |`Center`|The contents of the panel are centered.| |`Right`|The contents of the panel are right-aligned.|
> [!NOTE] > . If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.NotSet> but the property is set in the control that contains the panel control, the setting is inherited from the containing control.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> properties of two panel controls, `Panel1` and `Panel2`, to the `HorizontalAlign.Center` enumeration value. For an .aspx file that can be used to run the example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> topic.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The horizontal alignment is not one of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void MergeWith (System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void MergeWith(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub MergeWith (s As Style)
public: override void MergeWith(System::Web::UI::WebControls::Style ^ s);
override this.MergeWith : System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style -> unit

Docs.param: A object that represents the style settings to combine with the object.
Docs.summary: Combines the style settings of the specified object with the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style settings of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method copies non-blank elements from the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object, `s`, but does not replace any existing style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object. To replace the style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object with the style settings in `s`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars ScrollBars { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars ScrollBars
Public Overridable Property ScrollBars As ScrollBars

member this.ScrollBars : System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the visibility and position of scroll bars in a panel control.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property specifies the visibility and position of scroll bars in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars> enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`None`|No scroll bars are shown.| |`Horizontal`|Only a horizontal scroll bar is shown.| |`Vertical`|Only a vertical scroll bar is shown.| |`Both`|Both horizontal and vertical scroll bars are shown.| |`Auto`|If necessary, horizontal, vertical, or both scroll bars are shown. Otherwise, no scroll bars are shown.|
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> properties of two panel controls, `Panel1` and `Panel2`, to the `ScrollBars.Both` enumeration value. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The property is not one of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Wrap { get; set; }
.property instance bool Wrap
Public Overridable Property Wrap As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Wrap { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Wrap : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content wraps within the panel.
Docs.value: if the content wraps within the panel; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property indicates whether the content wraps within the panel. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars.Auto>, if the content of the panel is longer than what will fit in the panel, the content of the panel will appear on one line with a horizontal scroll bar. When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars.None>, the panel will extend and if necessary the Web page will have a horizontal scroll bar.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property to `false` for two panel controls, `Panel1` and `Panel2`. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/CS/panelstyle.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle/VB/panelstyle.vb#2)]
